insights.title: Language Insights
insights.description: Overview of differences and history from phylogenetic and phonetic perspectives (representative samples).
insights.empty.title: No matching languages found
insights.empty.description: Please change filter conditions or reset.
insights.phoneticsNote.indoEuropean: Characteristic consonant clusters, vowel systems, and historical traces of inflection and ablaut.
insights.phoneticsNote.sinoTibetan: Focus on tones and syllable structure. Significant phonetic and lexical differences between Mandarin and Southern languages.
insights.phoneticsNote.afroAsiatic: Link between phonology and morphology seen in stress, pharyngealized sounds, and triconsonantal roots.
insights.phoneticsNote.uralic: Prominent vowel harmony and case systems. Strong agglutination with suffixes attached to stems.
insights.phoneticsNote.turkic: Vowel harmony and agglutinative morphology. SOV word order is common.
insights.phoneticsNote.default: Phylogenetic differences are visible when focusing on the interaction of phonology, morphology, and word order.
insights.detail.features.indoEuropean: Inflectional features, complex consonant clusters, flexible word order.
insights.detail.features.sinoTibetan: Tonal language, monosyllabic roots, word order determines meaning.
insights.detail.features.afroAsiatic: Triconsonantal roots, pharyngealized sounds, prominent stress patterns.
insights.detail.features.uralic: Vowel harmony, agglutinative features, developed case system.
insights.detail.features.turkic: Vowel harmony, agglutinative, SOV basic word order.
insights.detail.features.default: Phylogenetic differences visible in phonology, morphology, and word order interaction.
insights.detail.phoneticChanges.title: Phonetic Changes
insights.detail.history.title: Historical Sound Changes
insights.detail.history.sinoTibetan.old: â€¢ Old Chinese (11th c. BC): Complex initials, no tones
insights.detail.history.sinoTibetan.midd: â€¢ Middle Chinese (Sui-Tang): 4 tones established, rhyme system complete
insights.detail.history.sinoTibetan.earl: â€¢ Early Modern (Song-Yuan): Loss of entering tone, tone changes
insights.detail.history.indoEuropean.ger: â€¢ Germanic: Grimm's Law, consonant shifts
insights.detail.history.indoEuropean.mod: â€¢ Modern: Independent development in regions
insights.detail.history.general.title: Phylogenetic Sound Changes
insights.detail.history.general.desc: Historical sound change patterns specific to each family are observed.

insights.detail.comparison.desc: Compare with other languages. Compare phonology, word order, grammar, etc.
